body_html:
The 1.4 code is different: it uses a tf.FixedLenFeature named "mau_d180", whereas the code you're trying in 1.2 uses a tf.VarLenFeature named "f1".

The FixedLenFeature code should work in 1.2 if you convert the return type to a tuple. The VarLenFeature code won't work in either version until we add tf.SparseTensor support.

For many common cases, the tf.contrib.data.read_batch_features() function (available in TF 1.2 and 1.4) should work, even with tf.SparseTensor-valued features.
body_text:
The 1.4 code is different: it uses a tf.FixedLenFeature named "mau_d180", whereas the code you're trying in 1.2 uses a tf.VarLenFeature named "f1".
The FixedLenFeature code should work in 1.2 if you convert the return type to a tuple. The VarLenFeature code won't work in either version until we add tf.SparseTensor support.
For many common cases, the tf.contrib.data.read_batch_features() function (available in TF 1.2 and 1.4) should work, even with tf.SparseTensor-valued features.
body:
The 1.4 code is different: it uses a `tf.FixedLenFeature` named `"mau_d180"`, whereas the code you're trying in 1.2 uses a `tf.VarLenFeature` named `"f1"`. 

The `FixedLenFeature` code should work in 1.2 if you convert the return type to a tuple. The `VarLenFeature` code won't work in either version until we add `tf.SparseTensor` support.

For many common cases, the [`tf.contrib.data.read_batch_features()`](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.2/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/data/read_batch_features) function (available in TF 1.2 and 1.4) should work, even with `tf.SparseTensor`-valued features.
